div.ab: It is necessary that it be well cooked, which you will recognize when cooking it in an iron or metal pot, you mix it with an iron rod, & if it attaches to the iron, it is not cooked enough, if not, it is good. The water with which you temper it should be a little warm & the mold made with the aforesaid earth also a little hot. The work of plaster does not last & the faces & delicate things break if one does not give a coat of glue.
